intro: Sclerothamnus ebrenbergii, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant has adapted to harsh desert conditions with thick, waxy leaves that reduce water loss. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access groundwater in dry environments. Sclerothamnus ebrenbergii plays an important ecological role by providing shelter and food for desert wildlife.
